body.p: Before studying the structure of mdoc manuals, let's formalise the language we've seen so far. We've already noted that mdoc documents are line-based: some lines, demarked by a leading ., are interpreted as macros. Those without the leading . are free-text. We've even seen examples of partial-line and full-line comments.
body.div:
.Xx Arguments to the macro Xx.
Free-form text. \" A partial comment.
.\" A full-line comment.
